Pre-Game Insights: Iceland aim to kick off their 2024-25 UEFA Nations League campaign with a win as they host Montenegro in Group 4 of League B.
Iceland have kept clean sheets in 50% of their last six competitive matches.
Montenegro have failed to score in three of their last six games.
Seven of Iceland’s last ten home fixtures have featured under 2.5 goals.
Iceland, under the management of Age Hareide, will look to improve on their previous campaign in League B, where they finished second in their group.
Montenegro finished third in their group last time out and are still trying to find their footing at this level.
The best value bet for this fixture is Iceland to win and under 2.5 goals, primarily due to the recent form of both teams and the playing styles they are expected to deploy.
Iceland have only conceded 1.6 goals per game in their last 12 competitive matches.
Montenegro managed 1.1 goals per game in their Euro 2024 qualification campaign.
Montenegro’s reliance on key players like Stevan Jovetic and Stefan Mugosa means that when these individuals do not perform, the team’s attacking threat diminishes considerably.
